You called your team mates "noobs" and refused to help them. Regardless of whether it's true, calling your team mates "noobs", or anything of the like, is *never* going to help the situation (think about how you would react to being called a "noob"). Refusing to help team mates is enough to constitute "intent to lose", which *is* punishable. While not worthy of a 14-day ban *in and of itself*, the fact that you *just* had a 25 game chat restriction caused the punishment to be escalated to the next tier, which is the 14-day ban.

Keep up that behaviour and the next punishment *will* be a perma-ban, with no chance of a successful appeal.

Seems like you should go back and read the last sentence of the main paragraph, because you either haven't actually read it, or didn't bother to actually understand it.
Have you question your last statement? They escalate it to the next tier because he type in they are a nub and refusing to help?

It got escalated to the next tier because the toxicity continued. As I stated, it only went to a 14-day ban because they had pretty much *just* come off a 25 game chat restriction. It's the *normal* escalation of the system in cases like this. If they hadn't previously had a 25 game chat restriction, they wouldn't have a 14-day ban now.

That logic is flawed. The offence is not note worthy. He must've typed something more; What is posted up there is within the acceptable TOS rules. 

Take note. League Solo Q treatment is playing to win, not coach the guy that doing bad, it not a guild system, there is no merrit to even help a feeder/troll. Sometimes you just type in chat to let them know, the kind of "fun" they are having, is fking every 1 else over.

> What is posted up there is within the acceptable TOS rules.

That's an outright bogus claim, and either you haven't thoroughly read the ToU, or you just haven't paid enough attention when you have.

[Terms of Use](https://oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/legal/termsofuse); Section 5 **Code of Conduct**:
> While using the Riot Services, you must comply with all laws, rules and regulations in the jurisdiction in which you reside. You must also comply with certain additional rules that govern your use of the Riot Services (the “Code of Conduct”). The Code of Conduct is not meant to be exhaustive, and we reserve the right to modify it at any time, as well as take appropriate disciplinary measures including account termination and deletion to protect the integrity and spirit of the Riot Services, regardless of whether a specific behaviour is listed in the policy as inappropriate. In addition to the Code of Conduct, please review the Summoner’s Code (http://gameinfo.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/game-info/get-started/summoners-code/ *could also use this link instead: https://oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/featured/summoners-code*) for additional guidance on exemplary gameplay behaviour.
> The following are examples of behaviour that warrant disciplinary measures:
> ...
> Transmitting or communicating any content which is deemed offensive, including language that is unlawful, harmful, threatening, abusive, harassing, defamatory, vulgar, obscene, sexually explicit, or racially, ethically, or otherwise objectionable;

I highly recommend you go and properly familiarise yourself with both the [ToU](https://oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/legal/termsofuse) *and* the [Summoner's Code](https://oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/featured/summoners-code).

> League Solo Q treatment is playing to win, not coach the guy that doing bad, it not a guild system, there is no merrit to even help a feeder/troll.

No one is always expecting you to "coach the guy that is doing bad", and certainly no one is expecting you to attempt helping an intentional feeder or a troll, *however* that doesn't mean you go bat-sh!t at them (and everyone else you deem "deserves it") and make the whole situation a lot worse. Fact is, people respond negatively to abuse, harassment and the like, while they respond more positively to constructive criticism and helpful individuals.

Bottom line, *if you don't have anything nice to say, don't say anything*.

Nice last quote. Except this isnt fantasy land. There are times people need to be told they are shit and they need to improve; any high stress, high paying job demand the end result. When people are failling their tasks, or underperform; There is a personel that come to tell them to improve their result or get fired "no constructed critic, no spare feeling, straight up get better or get another job".

To use your job metaphor, there's a difference between telling your employee "These KPIs really aren't great you need to get on this" and "wow why are you so bad? why do you even come in? Stfu".

Not to mention that in game a player has no obligation to magically be better just because you said so. You aren't their boss, and while there is the expectation that you are playing to win in ranked, that doesn't mean players are magically not going to have bad games. 

You're saying you've never had a really bad game? You've never racked up 10 deaths far too quickly because the enemy is just that much better than you, or you're just that tilted? Would you want your team typing asshole bs at you for that when I'm sure you know you're doing bad or would you prefer they themselves actually play to win instead of just giving up because you lost lane?

It's really not that hard to just not be an ass.

Yes this is a game, its not payed. But if you apply the same mentality of progression and factors that hinder it. You would get a similar results as the business world.
